faq.question: What is the difference between JPG and PNG?
faq.answer: JPG uses lossy compression and does not support transparency. PNG uses lossless compression and supports transparent backgrounds, making it ideal for logos and graphics.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple JPG files at once?
faq.answer: Yes. Use batch conversion to convert dozens or hundreds of JPG images to PNG in one go — all processed locally in your browser.

faq.answer: Yes. FreeConvert.tools offers unlimited free conversions with no registration, no file size limits, and 100% privacy — your files never leave your device.

faq.question: Will converting JPG to PNG improve quality?
faq.answer: PNG preserves the current pixel data without further lossy compression. It won't restore quality lost when the original was saved as JPG, but it prevents future quality loss.

faq.question: Why convert MKV to MP4?
faq.answer: MKV is common for downloads but many devices (TVs, phones, game consoles) don't support it. MP4 plays everywhere.

faq.question: Will quality be preserved?
faq.answer: When possible, the converter preserves quality. Re-encoding may be needed for compatibility.

faq.question: Can I convert 4K MKV?
faq.answer: Yes. Large files are supported. Processing time depends on your device.

faq.question: Are subtitles preserved?
faq.answer: MP4 has limited subtitle support. Complex MKV subtitles may need separate handling.

faq.question: Why convert MP4 to MOV?
faq.answer: Final Cut Pro, iMovie, and other Apple tools sometimes prefer MOV. Useful for Mac-based editing.

faq.question: Will quality be preserved?
faq.answer: Yes. Both can use the same codecs. Conversion preserves quality.

faq.question: Is MOV better for editing?
faq.answer: MOV supports ProRes and other edit-friendly codecs. For H.264 content, MP4 and MOV are similar.

faq.question: Can I use MOV on Windows?
faq.answer: MOV plays on Windows in many apps, but MP4 is more universal. Use MOV when targeting Apple workflows.
